messages.title: It's time for positive change
messages.content: Jack Lopresti lives in Filton with his wife and three children and has done for years. Jack has been working hard for local residents from fighting to keep facilities at Frenchay Hospital to helping local residents with issues from potholes to pensions. If Jack is re-elected as your MP he will continue this hard work.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support and investment in the local economy, defense industry, and high tech employment.
Fighting to keep facilities at Frenchay Hospital.
Opposition to the imposition of 33,000 extra houses in South Gloucestershire without sufficient funds or infrastructure to support them.
Working on improving local and national transport links and campaigning for a regular shuttle service from Parkway to MOD Abbeywood.

mentions.candidate: As a Filton resident, Jack is in touch with the constituency through 'listening events' and actions to increase jobs and combat the number of PCSOs.
mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Reference to David Cameron and a warning about not allowing Gordon Brown to sneak back into power.

issues.economy: Support for the local economy, defense industry, and high tech employment.

housing.content: Opposition to the imposition of 33,000 extra houses in South Gloucestershire without sufficient funds or infrastructure to support them.

leaflet.personalStatement: Jack Lopresti lives in Filton with his wife and three children and has done for years.

politicalExperience.achievements: Working on issues from potholes to pensions, improving transport links, supporting local economy.

images.caption: Photos of Jack Lopresti with various groups of people and at various events
